scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In this series of letters, Mary Jane Holmes answers requests for autographs, photographs and her religious views; discusses her story, "The Hepburn Line or the Missing Link" and its possible syndication; and describes her approach to writing. Correspondents include Lippincott's Magazine,Joseph Marshall Stoddart, James Cephas Derby, W. R. Darlon.

did.unittitle: M. J. H. to James Cephas Derby [1884?] Mar 20

scopecontent.p: Recalls she began early to write stories. Mentions Mr. Hart and Mr. Carleton. Describes her approach to writing, and thanks Derby for including her work in his book.

did.unittitle: Mary Jane Holmes to Editors of Lippincotts Magazine1893 May 20

scopecontent.p: Offers story entitled "The Hepburn Line or The Missing Link." Feels it is worth five hundred dollars.

did.unittitle: M. J. H. to Joseph Marshall Stoddart 1894 Dec 17

scopecontent.p: Refers to her work "Hepburn Line" and discusses possible syndication.

did.unittitle: M. J. H. to W. R. Darlon n. y. Apr 14

scopecontent.p: Answers request for autograph. with separate ANS, "Yours truly Mary J. Holmes, Brockport N. Y."
